basic_level.question: Which virus causes poliomyelitis?
basic_level.explanation: Poliomyelitis is caused by poliovirus, which is an enterovirus belonging to the Picornaviridae family. It has three serotypes: PV1, PV2, and PV3.

basic_level.question: Which cells in the central nervous system are primarily affected by the poliovirus?
basic_level.explanation: Poliovirus primarily affects the anterior horn cells of the spinal cord, which are lower motor neurons. This leads to the characteristic flaccid paralysis seen in poliomyelitis.
